summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting that subpoenas be served on multiple financial institutions (Wells Fargo, USAA, TD Bank, Navy Federal Credit Union, MCU, JPMC, Citibank, Bank of America) in relation to the Epstein investigation. The email instructs the recipient to attach an OB211 form to each subpoena.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email requesting service of subpoenas on financial institutions related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Service Request
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests service of subpoenas on eight major financial institutions (Wells Fargo, USAA, TD Bank, Navy Federal Credit Union, MCU, JPMC, Citibank, Bank of America) for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: On August 17, 2019, federal prosecutors were actively issuing subpoenas to multiple financial institutions as part of the Epstein investigation.
The subpoenas targeted eight major banks and credit unions: Wells Fargo, USAA Federal Savings Bank, TD Bank, Navy Federal Credit Union, MCU, JPMorgan Chase (JPMC), Citibank, and Bank of America.
The request included attaching a specific form (OB211) to each subpoena, indicating a standardized legal process.
The correspondence shows the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's finances was broad and involved seeking records from a wide range of financial entities.
